com.jayeshtajane.simplejdbc.template.query

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayeshtajane.simplejdbc.template.query.Query

  • public class Query
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is use to perform a database operations. You don't need to create this object. You have just call the createQuery() method which is present in JdbcTemplate.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jayesh Tajane
    See Also:
    JdbcTemplate.createQuery(String), JdbcTemplate.createQuery(String, Object...)

      Creating Query object by using userQuery, connection and queryParam

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • Query

        public Query(java.lang.String userQuery,
             java.sql.Connection connection)

        Creating Query object by using userQuery and connection . Setting connection and statement.

        Parameters:
        userQuery - - SQL query provided by programmer.
        connection - - Connection object

      • Query

        public Query(java.lang.String userQuery,
             java.sql.Connection connection,
             java.lang.Object... queryParam)

        Creating Query object by using userQuery, connection and queryParam

        Parameters:
        userQuery - - SQL query provided by programmer.
        connection - - Connection object
        queryParam - - Values that you want to replace with question marks that are present in query. Order must follow.

    • Method Detail

      • setQueryParam

        public void setQueryParam(int index,
                          java.lang.Object data)

        Setting parameters to Query object. This function internally set the provided data to the PreparedStatement object.

        Parameters:
        index - - indicates the index of question mark in query. Not exactly index see the example.
        data - - indicates the value that you want to replace with question marks given index in query.

      • setQueryParam

        public void setQueryParam(java.lang.Object... data)

        Setting Setting parameters to Query object. This function internally set the provided data to the PreparedStatement object using setQueryParam(int index, Object data). Position of data is matters.

        Parameters:
        data - - indicates the list of values that you want to replace with question marks of query. Order must follow.

      • update

        public int update()

        When you want to execute the non-select query means CREATE, UPADATE, DELETE etc. then use this function

        Returns:
        - number of rows affected.

      • get

        public <T> T get(RowMapper<T> rowMapper)

        When your operation is SELECT and you know the query returns only one or zero row then use this function. If your query returns the more than two rows then the first row of that result will return.

        Parameters:
        rowMapper - - implementation class of RowMapper
        Returns:
        - object of T

      • load

        public <T> java.util.List<T> load(RowMapper<T> rowMapper)

        When your operation is SELECT and you know the query returns zero more rows then use this function.

        Parameters:
        rowMapper - - implementation class of RowMapper
        Returns:
        - List
